overall.recommendation: Proceed with caution - mitigation plan required
overall.methodology: Weighted average of 5 risk dimensions using risk-matrix.json scoring criteria

bondRequirements.description: No bonds required (bid, performance, or payment)
bondRequirements.evidence: RFP Section 3.2 - No bond requirements stated

paymentTerms.evidence: Standard government payment terms, Net 30 from invoice

retainage.evidence: Full payment per invoice, no holdback

contractValue.evidence: Total estimated annual value $519,207 based on 35 generator quotes
contractValue.calculation: $519k within company capacity but requires dedicated resources

cashFlowImpact.evidence: Regular quarterly Service A+B visits provide steady revenue
cashFlowImpact.calculation: Positive cash flow, minimal working capital required

financial.notes: Low financial risk overall. No bonds reduce upfront costs. Net 30 terms are standard. Contract size manageable within current capacity. Prevailing wage costs pass through to customer.

distance.description: 49 miles from base to LBNL Berkeley
distance.evidence: Google Maps: Energen base to 1 Cyclotron Road = 49 miles

generatorCount.description: 35 generators + 3 air compressors + 1 light tower = 38 units total
generatorCount.calculation: 35 generators falls in 21-40 range = score 5, +1 for air compressor complexity = score 6

timeline.description: 6 weeks from bid due to contract start
timeline.evidence: Bid due Dec 15, contract start Jan 1 = 17 days
timeline.calculation: Short mobilization period but feasible with planning

resourceAvailability.description: Requires dedicated 2-person crew for quarterly visits
resourceAvailability.evidence: 332.5 annual labor hours requires dedicated crew allocation
resourceAvailability.calculation: Within capacity but requires crew commitment

seasonalChallenges.evidence: Berkeley, CA - mild climate, no severe seasonal challenges
seasonalChallenges.calculation: Quarterly schedule spreads work across all seasons

multiSiteComplexity.calculation: All on one campus but requires routing between buildings

operational.notes: Moderate operational risk. Distance 49 miles is manageable for quarterly visits. 35 generators is substantial but within capacity with dedicated crew. Campus layout adds minor complexity. Timeline is tight but achievable.
evidence: Equipment list: 35 units in different buildings (02 EG 068, 30 EG 114, etc.)
Distance calculation: 49 miles one-way = 98 miles round trip

prevailingWage.description: PREVAILING WAGE REQUIRED - Highest compliance risk
prevailingWage.evidence: Government contract for public institution requires DIR registration and certified payroll
prevailingWage.calculation: Prevailing wage = score 10 per risk-matrix.json (maximum compliance risk)
prevailingWage.costImpact: +40% labor costs compared to standard commercial rates

licenses.evidence: C-10 Electrical or C-61 D-07 Generator Systems

insurance.evidence: GL $2M, Auto $1M, WC Statutory, Additional Insured required

environmental.description: Standard environmental compliance for generator work
environmental.evidence: Hazmat handling, oil disposal, coolant recycling - standard practices
environmental.calculation: No special environmental requirements beyond standard

safety.evidence: LBNL is DOE facility, may require badging, safety training, escorts
safety.calculation: Higher than commercial but standard for government facilities

compliance.notes: HIGH COMPLIANCE RISK due to prevailing wage requirement. This is the primary risk factor for this RFP. Requires DIR registration (30 days), certified payroll system ($5k), and ongoing compliance monitoring. Labor costs increase ~40% but pass through to customer. Insurance requirements are elevated but obtainable.
evidence: Government contract indicator: California Franchise Tax Board agency
Public institution: LBNL is DOE national laboratory
Industry standard: Public works contracts >$1k require prevailing wage
DIR website: Contractor registration required for public works

evaluationCriteria.description: Evaluation criteria not clearly specified in RFP
evaluationCriteria.evidence: RFP does not detail scoring weights (price vs. qualifications)

incumbentAdvantage.description: Likely existing service provider with institutional knowledge
incumbentAdvantage.evidence: 35 generators at major facility suggest ongoing maintenance contract
incumbentAdvantage.calculation: Incumbent likely has site knowledge, relationships = score 6

expectedBidders.calculation: Typical government RFP draws 3-5 bidders = score 5

priceWeight.description: Government contracts typically emphasize lowest price
priceWeight.evidence: Public procurement law favors low bidder when qualifications equal

differentiationOpportunity.description: Moderate opportunity to differentiate on quality/service
differentiationOpportunity.evidence: Premium service quality, advanced diagnostics, reporting capabilities
differentiationOpportunity.calculation: Can differentiate but price still primary factor = score 4

competitive.notes: Moderate competitive risk with unknown landscape. Likely facing incumbent with site knowledge and customer relationships. Government procurement typically favors low price when qualifications are equal. Opportunity to differentiate on quality but price pressure expected.
evidence: LBNL website shows existing generator maintenance contract
Government bidding typically has 3-5 qualified respondents
California procurement law: CA Public Contract Code 10340-10381

equipmentComplexity.description: Mix of standard and specialty equipment
equipmentComplexity.evidence: 90% standard generators (Cummins, Kohler, CAT), one 2000kW specialty unit
equipmentComplexity.calculation: Mostly standard = score 3, +1 for 2000kW complexity = score 4

specializedSkills.description: Standard generator technician skills with one specialty requirement
specializedSkills.evidence: 2000kW Cummins requires advanced certification or Cummins support

partsAvailability.description: Good parts availability for standard units
partsAvailability.evidence: Cummins, Kohler, CAT parts readily available in Bay Area
partsAvailability.specialConcern: 2000kW unit may require stocking critical spares ($3k)

customWork.description: Air compressors and light tower add non-standard work
customWork.evidence: 3 Sullivan-Palatek air compressors, 1 Multiquip light tower
customWork.calculation: Different service protocols than generators = score 4

diagnosticRequirements.description: Standard PM diagnostics, load bank testing

trainingNeeded.description: Minimal training required beyond standard skills
trainingNeeded.evidence: 2000kW unit training, air compressor service protocols

technical.notes: Low-moderate technical risk. 90% of equipment is standard generators from major manufacturers (Cummins, Kohler, CAT). Main technical challenge is the 2000kW Cummins unit which requires specialized knowledge - recommend Cummins partnership. Air compressors add minor complexity but manageable.
evidence: Equipment list: Cummins (20), Kohler (5), CAT (3) = 80% of generators
Air compressors: Sullivan-Palatek models D260PDKR, D375PHJD4AF
Light tower: Multiquip LT12 Nighthawk (minimal service requirements)
mitigationRecommended: Partner with Cummins Pacific for 2000kW technical support ($3k/year)
Stock critical spares for 2000kW unit ($3k inventory)
Train crew on Sullivan-Palatek air compressor service (8 hours)
Allocate extra time for 2000kW service (6 hours vs. 4 hours standard)

overallCalculation.note: Compliance risk (8.0) significantly elevates overall score despite low technical and financial risk

riskLevelClassification.definition: Proceed with caution - mitigation plan required

thresholds.orange: 5.1-7.0 (Elevated risk, mitigation plan REQUIRED, management review)
thresholds.red: 7.1-10.0 (High risk, executive review required, consider no-bid)

criticalRisks.impact: Labor costs increase 40%, requires DIR registration and certified payroll
Competing against incumbent with institutional knowledge
mitigationActions: Attend mandatory site visit to demonstrate interest
Submit detailed questions to show expertise
Assign dedicated 2-person crew for LBNL route
Pre-schedule all quarterly visits for year
Coordinate annual services to minimize trips

actions.action: Implement certified payroll system (LCPtracker or similar)
Train payroll staff on prevailing wage requirements

actions.expectedReduction: Reduces compliance risk from 10 to 6 (still elevated but manageable)

actions.action: Partner with Cummins Pacific for technical support

actions.expectedReduction: Reduces technical risk from 4 to 2 for specialty unit

mitigationPlan.recoveryPlan: All mitigation costs ($11,100) recovered in first year through contract margin

recommendations.rationale: 30-day processing time, required before contract start

recommendations.action: Research prevailing wage rates for Alameda County
recommendations.rationale: Accurate pricing requires current wage determinations

recommendations.action: Contact Cummins Pacific for 2000kW support agreement
recommendations.rationale: Technical support essential for specialty unit
Required for bid eligibility, opportunity to assess site

recommendations.action: Allocate dedicated crew for LBNL route

confidenceLevel.notes: High confidence in assessment based on complete RFP data and equipment list. Prevailing wage requirement is confirmed. Mitigation costs are estimated based on industry standards.

ambiguities: Exact prevailing wage rates not specified in RFP (requires DOL lookup)
dataGaps: Exact scoring criteria for proposal evaluation

nextReview.trigger: After site visit, update operational risk assessment
